bullets.text: U.S. compensation costs rose 0.7% (Sep–Dec 2025) and 3.4% YoY, signaling persistent wage-driven inflation pressure.
U.S. credit-card debt topped $1.28T, highlighting consumer strain and a widening “K-shaped” divide despite strong asset markets.
December retail sales were flat and missed estimates, pointing to softer consumer demand into early 2026.
China January CPI rose less than expected while PPI deflation persisted, reinforcing weak domestic demand and continued industrial price pressure.
Ford expects EV losses to continue ~3 more years, underscoring difficult path to EV profitability even as 2026 guidance improves.
Lyft announced a $1B buyback, but shares fell on weak results and rider trends, suggesting capital returns can’t offset slowing fundamentals.
Alphabet’s debt raise reportedly exceeded $30B, signaling continued mega-cap reliance on cheap funding and investor appetite for high-grade corporate paper.
Bitcoin slid sharply; analysts cite cyclical dynamics while Strategy’s Saylor plans refinancing, highlighting leverage and refinancing risk in crypto-linked corporates.
EPA plans to revoke the “endangerment finding,” threatening the legal foundation of U.S. climate regulation and raising long-term policy risk for energy and industry.
Taiwan rejected Washington’s 40% chip-supply relocation target as “impossible,” showing limits to rapid semiconductor reshoring amid geopolitical pressure.
Hong Kong is advancing stablecoin licensing despite Beijing’s reservations, potentially creating a regulated crypto-finance hub alongside mainland restrictions.
Guatemala will end use of Cuban doctors under U.S. pressure, illustrating health-services diplomacy and Washington’s leverage in the region.
AI can read brain MRIs in seconds and flag emergencies, promising faster triage and productivity gains but increasing reliance on model validation and clinical integration.
Research identifies ancient genes predating all life, potentially reshaping models of early evolution and the minimum genetic toolkit needed for cellular life.
Post-2020 methane spike traced to unexpected sources, raising uncertainty for near-term climate forcing and the effectiveness of current emissions monitoring assumptions.
